content.description: Sit start under a slight overhang to the left of the crack system facing southwest. Start on two sloper pockets and work your way up. Hard mantle/top out.
content.location: Southwest corner of boulder 3 feet left of the crack.

content.description: Sit start on the flake/crack in the center of the northeast face of the Maritime boulder. Follow the crack and crimps up to the pyramid shaped top.
content.location: Center of the northeast face of the Maritime boulder.

content.description: Stand start on the right side of the largest face on crack-pockets. Traverse up and left on pockets then slap your left hand to a sloper sidepull around the arete. Finally, move up to a jug rail and then work your way to the top.
content.protection: At least two pads and a spotter

content.description: Sit start in the bottom right of the crack on the main face, go up left to the starting holds of Maritimer, and then up right to a sloper. After that go left to a 3-finger pocket and go directly up the center of the main face on decent holds.
Stand start with your hands in the crack to the left of the main face and to the right of Rock The Boat. Work up the crack and follow the water groove to the top.
content.location: Around the corner to the left of Maritimer and three feet to the right of Rock The Boat.

content.description: Sit start at the arete on the northeast side of the Maritime boulder. Work your hands up the arete and keep your feet on the face until you reach the top...top out at the peak.
content.location: Maritime boulder, arete on the northeast corner on the smaller side of the boulder closer to the top of the ridge.

content.description: On the small roof to the right of Man Overboard, Sit Start on a left-hand crimp side-pull and a right-hand crimp. Get your feet up and move your right hand to a crimp higher up the roof, then move your left foot up and make a really difficult move to a left-hand crimp near the lip. Once at the lip, slap-up and over to crimps then finally to a decent edge/crack and pull over. It's very hard not to dab or peel off while climbing the problem and pulling the lip as you are quite close to the ground and the holds are bad. Super overhung.
content.location: On the Maritime boulder in the Western Frontier area of DEKD. Sit starts low on the roof to the right of Man Overboard that goes directly up the tallest face.

content.description: A large boulder on the ridge 100-150 yards west of the Dirty Crack boulder. This boulder has the coolest features of any we have found at DEKD. You definitely want a spotter as the landings are good but small. Pinches, pockets, and slopers on water eroded grippy stone.
